title: Inactivity.
content:
Holy cow, you people really don't post much, do you? Even all the smallest forums I've been to, ones with only 25 active members, we've pulled in more posts. In short, I don't think PCKF is livining it up like it could.

I think this site could use some new graphics, new forums, and (lmao) a new server.


I mean, you can get cheap servers for small forums like this, can't you? I know Naj was talking about that. Does anyone else know what I'm talking about?


We could just make this a bit of a nicer site. I think some more modern gamer-type graphics could add some interest and catch people's eyes.

We need more activity. The Misc. and Misc. Polls forum just isn't cutting it in my opinion. I mean, we could atleast draw from other things like: Graphics, debate and discussion, Social lounge, Newbie introduction (Maybe, kind hard since we get like only 2 new members a year), video gaming, movies/pop culture, and much more if we wanted.

I mean, there's a lot of activity we could have becides just sitting here watching this forum rot.


(Just a thought.)

EDIT: I know I'm talking abotu a lot here, but Jesus, can't we do something?~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Inactivity.
content:
Yeah, we need more activity, and I believe autumn/winter will bring some of that back again. At summer there's always less happening in this forum.

Anyways. If people don't seem to post enough even in these few off-topic areas, more of them might not be the solution. I think we have enough them. More than this would make the forum look a miscellaneous board with a few Commander Keen sections. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Afterall, this is a Keen forum, and not a general chit chat forum.

However, agree on new graphics. I'd like a fresh design again, more emotikeens, and such. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mort.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

One couldn't necessarily find that much expert advice from programming section of PCKF..

Naturally we want people to discuss stuff, but we don't (as far as I know) try to attract the non-Keening audience with different sub-forums. (Not that many would join if she/he didn't care about Keen.)3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"

title: Re: Inactivity.
content:
I disagree as well... and agree with Alex.
One big forum would be easier... make for a more tight community.
Well, potentially, since the playing and modding community are pretty much the same right now anyway.

[quote]Quote:[hr]"The PCKF allows some things which wouldn't be in K:M."[hr][/quote]

Are you talking about ezboard vs (...checking...) phpBB?
Because I don't think ezboard can do anything phpBB cannot... do.

If you're talking about the actual forum, then it's not the case, because the K:M forum would be renamed to something different, maybe PCKF, maybe something else completely, and the original K:M content would turn into a sub-forum there, just like the content now in the PCKF.
At least, that's the way I envision it, and I think the way the rest does as well.

I also wouldn't mind and art and programming sub-forum.
With disk space in mind, it's probably not a bad idea per s to clean out old threads every now and again either.
Most threads aren't that important anymore after a while, and if they are, they can be saved on an individual basis.
Perhaps someone is willing to backup everything on CD every now and again, in case someone wants to see something old again.

I personally believe the really important stuff is better off on an old-fashioned website or a wiki than a forum.
Forums are made for discussions, are dynamic by definition.
Sort of strange, actually, that nobody started a Commander Keen wiki yet.
Well, there's the Keencyclopedia of course, but that's only about the actual games, enemies, items, nothing much about story-pieces, technology, etc..
OK, getting way off-topic here, so I'll stop. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Retodon8

content:
Well, an artist that's good at drawing and happened to draw something Keen-related, isn't a Keen fan per se, but still somebody that could add to the community.
Someone that's good at programming that feels like hanging out somewhere, maybe helping others along the way isn't a bad thing to have in a forum either.
People liking retro gaming in general, not just Keen...
I'm sure there are more examples.
More members wouldn't be a bad thing.

More random people shouting random stuff would, I agree.
Read my post in the poll thread; I do not think lots of unrelated forums are wanted either.
Right now the community is small enough that with around 10 forums everything is easily overseeable.

Of course that'd probably be moreso with phpBB or similar, since I'm pretty confident in saying more people are used to that.
It's easy to subscribe to threads if things get busy, so you are alerted to interesting stuff, so you can ignore the rest.
People might even be "scared" of ezboard, since it's relatively different from the norm, not to mention the screwy Search feature and other annoyances.

OK, I'm bored writing now.Retodon8

title: Re: Inactivity
content:
Hmmm, most other old-but-still-popular games are more recent than Keen I think, so I can't really compare it to much.
Still, id might just turn the games freeware, or better yet, release the source code, and that might just breathe some new life into the thing.
That's one of the reasons why something like Doom is still popular actually.
It's playable on recent systems, including things like PDAs (I think, and if not it will be soon enough), with new features like a lighting and physic engine possible, as well as the ability to go beyond using custom art, levels, and even total conversions.

Since Keen didn't make such a big impact as Doom though, the breath of life will be smaller compared to Doom's source code release.
Also, perhaps id will never release the source code; who knows!
Still, I'm an optimist! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Retodon8

title: blah
content:
Back when Modding first became a possibility, there was still a stubborn and active fangaming community here, and there was a bit of a tear regarding whether or not "mods" counted as "fangames." Those who favored fangames said that 'using the official engine disqualifies it from fangame status!' while those who favored mods argued 'you can't get much more fan-based than breathing new life into the original!' ...in the end, the mods became a part of "Other Keen Stuff" while 'officially unofficial' fangames sat in the "Unofficial Keen Games" area.

Since click'n'play and all its bretheren have mostly winked out, and the community in general disapproves of the sub-standard quality presented by fangames of that sort, what's wrong with KeenMods being a part of the Unofficial section?

K:M arose because some of the mods at this board were unimpressed with the numerous "How do I get started? What do I need? Can I get a patch to do this?" kind of questions which were flooding "Other Keen Stuff" for a while. Andy set up K:M so that those who were only interested in Keen from an original-game basis wouldn't be subjected to the modding community.

title: Re: blah
content:
K:M and the PCKF should be separate.

title: Re: blah
content:
Since Spleen's computer won't let him access the PCKF, I'm posting this message for him:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Commander Spleen One thing I've long understood (but am only just beginning to live on a day-to-day basis) is that circumstances are not the cause of our problems. If you're in the right frame of mind, like I am right now, even things like ezBoard and IE (which I'm forced to use on this machine due to a strange quirk whereby Firefox refuses to add new posts to the PCKF) cannot stand in your way.

However, a more convenient interface would always be quite welcome, and it'd be kinda nice if we could access it via an RSS feed or something--I much prefer managing things from separate programs as oppposed to within a browser window. I'm still completely in favour of moving to a new forum, despite the problems it may cause in the short term.

I don't see how creating a pile of new miscellaneous forums could help things. The main thing I think this community needs is a central website for keeping track of news, releases and whatnot, basically summarising the events that take place on the forums for those who feel they don't have the time to sift through the myriad of posts that build up after a week or two. KeenRush and I were discussing such a possibility earlier this year, but he's been busy with other projects and I've not the skills to create it.

A new forum would make this much easier, but it would be possible to do this with the existing ezBoard. We could give several of the most active Keeners news posting rights, and each news item would include links back to, along with quotes from, the relevant threads. It'll also be easy to do a Keen Newsletter, since all the news would already be gathered.

If anyone's up for the challenge, we could hold a discussion on MSN/AIM/Jabber sometime.

I'll stick to my previous vow to keep out of the 'scene is dead' debate. Most of you should know my opinion already.[hr][/quote][url=http://toxicsheep.com]toxicsheep.com[/url] | [url=http://commanderkeen.org]coming up next...[/url]

title: Re: blah
content:
I think the thing is half the forum is about modding, and many people (like myself) are just keen fans who dont mod(so they can't discuss it) and just want to download the game.
I don't think the problem is its an old game (I've been to some very active King's Quest sites, as that is one of my favorite games as well) but that what is their to talk about Keen? I mean its a sidescrolling, arcadish game. Its not like you can talk a whole lot about the plot or characters or anything. You can just about only talk about the enemies and the environment, as well as the moves Keen does.
Oh, and i'm not trying to put down keen by any means.
That being said, one thing that would bring me more (myself being a rather irregular member) is trying to discuss more in the official games forum. More conversation and polls about who the best villains are, your favorite keen, what the coolest keen moves are, and soforth.

We need to come together and have a central place for all things Keen. I think it will bring keen fans together, and make a central place which is easy for people to find and understand.
